meanings.definition: Of or relating to a parent.
meanings.sent1: The parental love was evident in the way she cared for her children.
meanings.sent2: She displayed parental concern for her son's well-being.
meanings.sent3: The parental advice to always look both ways before crossing the street was taken very seriously.
meanings.sent4: His parental instincts kicked in when he saw the child wandering alone in the park.
meanings.sent5: The parental bond between mother and child was unbreakable.

meanings.definition: Having the relation of a parent.
meanings.sent1: The parental responsibilities weighed heavily on his shoulders.
meanings.sent2: She took on a parental role in guiding the younger members of the team.
meanings.sent3: The parental duties of feeding and caring for the newborn chicks kept the bird busy all day.
meanings.sent4: His parental authority was unquestioned among the neighborhood kids.
meanings.sent5: The parental instincts of protection and nurturing were strong in the animal kingdom.

meanings.sent1: The parental guidance provided by the teacher helped the students excel in their studies.
meanings.sent2: The puppy displayed parental behavior by licking her puppies clean.
meanings.sent3: The parental scolding for misbehaving was a common occurrence in the household.
meanings.sent4: His parental pride in his daughter's achievements was evident to all who knew him.
meanings.sent5: The parental care shown by the nurse towards the sick child was heartwarming.
